items.sentence: Tom and I don't do that as much as we used to.
Tom and I do that together as often as we can.
Tom said there was no need for you to do that.
You'll ask Tom to do that for Mary, won't you?
You knew Tom told Mary to do that, didn't you?
You asked Tom to do that for Mary, didn't you?
Why don't you get Tom to tell Mary to do that?
Tom would make Mary very happy if he did that.
Tom is fortunate that he's allowed to do that.
Tom initially said he wasn't going to do that.
